title: Drag, drugs and horse-drawn carriages: inside Freddie Mercury’s epic 39th birthday party
text:
One morning in August 1985, gold envelopes dropped through the letterboxes of dozens of selected houses in the UK. These were the homes of Freddie Mercury’s closest friends. Inside was an invitation to the Queen singer’s 39th birthday party and a return air ticket to Munich.

“Freddie Mercury invites you to a Black and White Drag Ball,” the letter stated in tasteful monochrome. The party was to be in Hendersons, a famous Munich cabaret bar, from 10pm on Thursday 5 September until 4am the next day. “Please come in Black/ White Drag Costume,” it instructed.
